Major_Arcs.title: Introduction and Ghost Town Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the main character, Nan, and the setting, Ghost Town, while establishing the central conflict: the impending destruction of the ghost town for a modern airport development.

sub_scenes.title: Nostalgia and Bar Conversation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the woman in the green hat expressing nostalgia for the Old West and then transitions to a bar conversation where Nan expresses her desire to visit Ghost Town, setting up her journey.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to Ghost Town and Woman's Nostalgia
Bar Conversation and Ghost Town Disagreement

sub_scenes.title: Arrival at Ghost Town and Airport Plan Revelation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Nan's arrival at Ghost Town and the introduction of new characters planning to build an airport, leading to Nan overhearing their devastating plans.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Solo Ride to Ghost Town
Modern Visitors and Airport Development Plan
Nan Overhears the Airport Plan and Reacts

Major_Arcs.title: Personal Turmoil and Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan's emotional turmoil and her confrontations with both past relationships and present dangers, including reflection on Cal and physical danger from construction workers.

sub_scenes.title: Reflection and Danger
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene delves into Nan's past relationship with Cal and then abruptly shifts to a dangerous encounter with construction workers at the ghost town.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Reflection on Past Relationship with Cal

sub_scenes.title: Business Deal and Father-Daughter Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to a business discussion involving Nan, her father, and an older man, focusing on the airport project and leading to a heated personal conflict between Nan and her father.

narrative_arcs.title: Offer of Horses and Father's Disapproval

sub_scenes.title: Conflicting Advice and Pursuit of Cal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Nan receiving conflicting advice from family and staff, followed by her decision to actively seek out Cal, driven by uncertainty about their relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Determination and Pursuit of Cal
Business Deal with Cowboys and Urgency

sub_scenes.title: Ultimatum and Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Nan confronting Cal with an ultimatum related to their relationship and the horses, leading to Cal's defiant departure and Nan's resignation.

Major_Arcs.title: Romantic and Weather Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc combines Nan's romantic anxieties with an external weather crisis, showing her emotional journey alongside a community-wide struggle against a severe snowstorm.

sub_scenes.title: Loneliness and Belated Confession
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene portrays Nan's growing loneliness after Cal's departure and her subsequent decision to pursue him again, leading to a belated confession of her feelings.

sub_scenes.title: Weather Warning and Community Response
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a severe weather crisis, interrupting Nan and Cal's personal moment and shifting focus to the community's collective concern for their cattle and livelihood.

sub_scenes.title: Hope and Despair during Snowstorm
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene portrays the fluctuating emotions during the snowstorm, from initial despair to fleeting hope and then renewed despair, culminating in unexpected relief.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: The Fodder Plane
Assessing the Situation and Lingering Concerns

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and Town Dynamics
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and explores the varied reactions and opinions of the townspeople towards his forceful persona and violent methods.

sub_scenes.title: Chane Benson's Display and Town's Reaction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Chane Benson through a violent act and showcases the townspeople's conflicting views on his character and methods, from admiration to criticism.

narrative_arcs.title: The Dangerous Casanova's Display of Force
Conflicting Views on Chane Benson's Heroism and Manners
Beyond Brute Force: Maturity and Civilization

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Gun Obsession and Mother's Concern
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to focus on Jeff, exploring his past hero worship and current gun obsession, leading to a confrontation with his mother about his behavior.

narrative_arcs.title: Reminiscing about Brother Jeff's Childhood Hero Worship
Initiating a Talk about Jeff's Gun Handling
Mother's Disappointment and Desire for Decency
Comparison to Chane Benson and Criticism of Clyde Surrett
Defense of Chane Benson and Mocking Duel with Clyde Surrett

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Influence and Rising Tension with Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shows the escalating influence of Chane Benson on Jeff and the growing tension between Benson and other town figures, particularly Clyde and Surrett.

sub_scenes.title: Mother's Resolve and Clyde's Support
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the mother's determination to help Jeff and Clyde's reassurance and shared responsibility in guiding Jeff away from Benson's negative influence.

narrative_arcs.title: Reassurance and Shared Responsibility for Jeff's Upbringing
Affection and Hope for Future Happiness
Reflection on Blissful Ignorance and Looming Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Benson's Advice and Ominous Demeanor
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Mr. Benson giving advice and then shifts to a narrative description of his unsettling demeanor and Sally's rejection of his influence.

narrative_arcs.title: Advice from Mr. Benson to Sally
Chane Benson's Cold Demeanor and Silent Observation
Rejection of Brother's Influence and Disdain for Young Boys

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Benson and Clyde's Warning
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts a direct confrontation between Surrett, Clyde, and Chane Benson, escalating tensions and resulting in Clyde warning Benson to leave.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Questioning of Benson's Intentions
Benson's Evasive Response and Assertion of Staying
Clyde's Intervention and Warning to Benson
Surrett's Further Inquiry and Clyde's Resolve to Stay
Clyde's Declaration of Action and Protection

Major_Arcs.title: Dinner Deception and Violent Showdown
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Sally's attempt to use dinner as a deceptive strategy, leading to a dinner shooting demonstration, escalating tensions, and culminating in a physical fight between Jeff and Benson.

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Invitation and Narrative Reflection
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Sally proposing a dinner invitation for Benson as a tactic, followed by narrative reflections on decency and courtesy and a time skip.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Benson and Dinner Invitation
Narrative Reflection on Decency and Courtesy
Narrative Time Skip and Jeff's Shift in Viewpoint

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Shooting and Escalating Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the awkward dinner scene, including a shooting demonstration by Benson, and then transitions to an outdoor confrontation and escalating physical interactions.

narrative_arcs.title: Dinner Shooting Demonstration and Sally's Concern

sub_scenes.title: Physical Fight and Aftermath
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene portrays the physical fight between Jeff and Benson, its immediate aftermath, and Sally's urgent plan to escape and warn Clyde.

narrative_arcs.title: Chane Benson's Provocation and Jeff's Anger
Sally's Urgency and the Escape Plan

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Escape and Armed Standoff
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene describes Jeff's escape and culminates in an armed nighttime standoff between Jeff and Benson, setting the stage for a final showdown.

Major_Arcs.title: Showdown and Resolution with Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc resolves the conflict with Chane Benson through a physical fight, leading to Benson's departure and a sense of resolution and future hope for Jeff and Sally.

sub_scenes.title: Verbal Duel and Agreed Fight
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the verbal confrontation between Jeff and Benson, their agreement to a fistfight, and their departure to engage in physical combat.

narrative_arcs.title: Headline Change and Relief at Return

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Troubles and Romantic Development (Betsy & Steve)
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new storyline focusing on ranch troubles and the developing romantic relationship between Betsy and Steve Daley, a hired gunfighter.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Confrontation and New Hire
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with a ranch confrontation and introduces Steve Daley as a newly hired gunfighter, setting up the context for ranch troubles and Betsy's need for help.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley and the Boss
Explanation of Steve's Hiring and Approval

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Logistics and Underlying Concerns
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene deals with logistical arrangements at the ranch and introduces discussions about ranch concerns, warnings of range war, and initial doubts about Steve Daley.

sub_scenes.title: Town Interactions and Rising Tension
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows interactions in town, including observations about 'Long Lady' and escalating tension leading to a physical confrontation with antagonists.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Firm Stance and Romantic Development
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Betsy's firm decisions about ranch management, her evolving feelings towards Steve, and the beginning of their romantic relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Love and the Dilemma of Profession

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Conflict and Romantic Resolution (Betsy & Steve)
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts a ranch confrontation with Bridges and his men, followed by Steve's internal reflection and decisive action, culminating in a violent showdown at Devil's Pass.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Confrontation and Steve's Reflection
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with a ranch confrontation with Bridges and his men and shifts to Steve's internal reflection on past events and lessons.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Bridges and his Men

sub_scenes.title: Decision to Fight and Devil's Pass Showdown
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Steve's decision to arm himself and confront the threat at Devil's Pass, leading to a violent gunfight and Betsy's arrival.

narrative_arcs.title: Steve's Decision to Arm Himself and Go to Devil's Pass
Betsy's Realization and Pursuit of Steve
Arrival at Devil's Pass and Initial Confrontation

Major_Arcs.title: Range War and Romantic Resolution (Carrie & Dave)
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new conflict related to range war and focuses on Carrie and Dave's relationship, leading to a marriage proposal amidst personal and external conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Range War Setup and Initial Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets up a new conflict about range war, starting with an argument and then introducing news of intruders on their range.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubling News at the Ranch
Discussion Among Intruders and Threat of Gunplay

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Romantic Proposal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Dave and Carrie's reconciliation after the range war confrontation, leading to a romantic proposal and acceptance.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Fred and Brotherly Matters
Carrie's Introspective Thoughts on Love and Anticipation
Intrusion and Questioning by Fred Gordon
Carrie's Rebuttal and Declaration of Love
Desire for Reconciliation and Invitation for Relaxation
Carrie's Reflection on Love for Fred and His Qualities
Carrie's Confession and Dave's Marriage Proposal

Major_Arcs.title: Carlton Contract Conflict and Carrie's Independence
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc revolves around the Carlton contract conflict, Carrie's confrontation with Carlton, and her assertion of independence, leading to emotional release and reconciliation with Dave and Fred.

sub_scenes.title: Carlton Contract Confrontation and Emotional Aftermath
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the escalating conflict over the Carlton contract, Carrie's confrontation with Carlton, and the subsequent emotional fallout and reconciliation.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusation of Deception and Plea of Love
Confrontation with Dave, Pete, and Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Romantic Resolution and Dirk's Wounded Arrival
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the romantic resolution between Carrie and Fred, intertwined with the dramatic and wounded arrival of Dirk, disrupting their newfound peace.

sub_scenes.title: Fred's Reflection and Town Encounter
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Fred's internal reflection on Carrie's words and then transitions to a chance encounter between Dave and Carrie in town, leading to emotional inquiries.

narrative_arcs.title: Chance Encounter and Emotional Inquiry in Town

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Sickbed and Romantic Reunion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Carrie unwell and anticipating a visitor, leading to revelations about the beef contract and a romantic reunion with Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Young Man's Confession and Carrie's Initial Reaction
Carrie's Flashback of Shame, Regret, and Happiness

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Wounded Arrival and Medical Care
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Dirk's sudden, wounded arrival and focuses on the immediate aftermath, including medical care and concern for his condition.

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Ranch Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the old man investigating Dirk's situation and Rance Cready's arrival at the ranch, leading to a tense confrontation with Chris Ransome.

narrative_arcs.title: Rance Cready's Arrival and Initial Encounter with Chris Ransome
Escalating Tension and Accusation at the Ranch

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Crime and Negotiation for Custody
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals Dirk's crime and the lawman's duty to apprehend him, leading to a negotiation between the lawman and a woman (Chris) regarding Dirk's custody.

narrative_arcs.title: Negotiation for Dirk's Custody and Care

sub_scenes.title: Lawman's Internal Conflict and Emotional Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the lawman's internal conflict and his tense emotional confrontation with Chris, exploring their complex relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Lawman's Internal Conflict and Shifting Perspective

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Confession and Reassurance
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene is centered around Chris and Rance's romantic confessions, reassurances, and Chris's lingering doubts about the sincerity of Rance's feelings.

narrative_arcs.title: Expression of Desire and Lingering Doubt

sub_scenes.title: Escape Proposal and Rejection
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Chris's attempt to help Dirk escape, Rance's rejection of her plan, and Chris's internal conflict and decision.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Rejection and Internal Conflict
Confrontation about Intentions and Daybreak Departure

Major_Arcs.title: The Chase and Final Reconciliation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the pursuit of Dirk and Chris by the Marshal (Rance), culminating in a violent confrontation and a final reconciliation between Chris and Rance.

sub_scenes.title: The Pursuit and Deadly Ultimatum
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the ongoing pursuit, confirms the chase, and escalates the tension with the Marshal issuing a deadly ultimatum.

sub_scenes.title: Violent Shootout and Immediate Aftermath
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene portrays the violent shootout, its chaotic nature, and the immediate aftermath, including Chris's reaction and actions.

narrative_arcs.title: Justification for Deadly Force and Injury Assessment
Desperate Escape Plan and Moral Objection

sub_scenes.title: Parting Ways and Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Chris and Dirk parting ways, Chris's reflection on Rance, and their eventual romantic reunion and marriage proposal, resolving their storyline.

narrative_arcs.title: Parting Ways and Confession of Love
Confession of Sleepless Vigil and Lingering Danger
Father's Tactful Exit and Anticipation of Private Discussion
Clarification of Father's Integrity and Dirk's Involvement
Declaration of Gratitude and Undying Affection

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Day and Unexpected Arrival
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to the wedding day, depicting the bride's reflections and apprehension, and culminating in Dirk's unexpected and disruptive arrival.

narrative_arcs.title: Acclamation and Anecdotal Praise for Rance
